data.event: The Nakhodka Bay, around which the city is organized, was discovered in 1859 by the Russian corvette Amerika, which sought shelter in the bay during a storm.
Until the 20th century, the area around the bay remained uninhabited, with the first settlement a small fishing village founded in 1907.

event.title: the 1930s, a number of small settlements were founded

data.event: When the Soviet government decided to build a harbor in the area in the 1930s, a number of small settlements were founded, which were merged as a work settlement in the 1940s.

event.title: were merged as a work settlement in the 1940s

data.event: When the Soviet government decided to build a harbor in the area in the 1930s, a number of small settlements were founded, which were merged as a work settlement in the 1940s.

event.title: May 18, 1950, the settlement, by then with a population of about 28,000 residents, was granted

data.event: On May 18, 1950, the settlement, by then with a population of about 28,000 residents, was granted town status.
